extract: The Reach Museum, also known as the Hanford Reach Interpretive Center, is a museum and visitor center for Hanford Reach National Monument located in Richland, Washington. The center tells a story of the cultural, natural, and scientific history of the Hanford Reach and Columbia Basin area, as well as promoting tourism. The Columbia River Exhibition of History, Science, and Technology (CREHST) was the predecessor that transitioned into what is now the Hanford Reach Interpretive Center. The Reach opened on July 1, 2014.
